questions.question: True or False: Before Islamic times, Arabs were polytheistic.

choices.answer: True
False

questions.question: What role did Muhammad play in the creation of the Islamic religion?

choices.answer: He wrote down stories he heard about Allah from others.
He received Allah's message and spread it to others.
He played no role in spreading the faith.
He was the writer of the Quran.

questions.question: Which of the following is one of the five pillars of Islam?

choices.answer: charity
pilgrimage to Mecca
fasting
praying to saints

questions.question: True or False: Giving alms to the poor is one of the five pillars of Islam.

choices.answer: True
False

choices.answer: submission to the will of God
one true God
the grace of God
believe in God's word

questions.question: What economic & social situation caused Muhammad to flee to the hills to meditate?

choices.answer: He left due to the growing gap between merchant & Bedouin.
He left after a riot left much of his property damaged.
He left during a time when the kings shunned Meccans.
None of these

questions.question: In the year 622, why did Muhammad move to Medina?

choices.answer: He left because of the drought.
He failed to convert Meccans to Islam.
He feared persecution from the Meccans.
Because there was a invading Bedouin army entering Mecca.

questions.question: True or False: Gabriel, Moses, and Jesus are incorporated into Islam's religious tradition.

choices.answer: True
False

questions.question: What is the difference between the way Christians view Jesus and the way Muslims view Muhammad?

choices.answer: Both Jesus and Muhammad are seen as divine.
Jesus is viewed as the Son of God while Muhammad is divine.
Muslims view Muhammad as a god.
Muslims see Muhammad as a prophet, not a divine figure.

questions.question: How did Islamic beliefs help trade and industry grow exponentially?

choices.answer: The Quran encouraged trade.
Islamic beliefs had no effect on trade and industry.
They helped by selling religious statues and artifacts.
Muhammad was a merchant.
